snippet: The sentence was imposed on members of the Bangladesh Rifles in connection with a 2009 mutiny in which scores were killed.
abstract: One hundred and fifty-two former members of the Bangladesh Rifles, paramilitary border security force, are sentenced to death in connection with a bloody 2009 mutiny in which several thousand troops took control of their headquarters, demanding better working conditions, and killed scores of people.

byline.original: By JULFIKAR ALI MANIK and ELLEN BARRY
byline.contributor: Julfikar Ali Manik reported from Dhaka, and Ellen Barry from New Delhi. Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The sentence was imposed on members of the Bangladesh Rifles in connection with a 2009 mutiny in which scores were killed.

headline.main: 152 Bangladeshi Border Guards Get Death Penalty Over Revolt
headline.print_headline: 152 Bangladeshi Border Guards Get Death Penalty Over Revolt
